time_blocks_table.create_sql:
CREATE TABLE time_blocks (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
    user_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
    uuid VARCHAR(36) UNIQUE NOT NULL,
    
    -- Core information
    title VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    description TEXT,
    block_type VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'focus',
    
    -- Visual customization
    icon VARCHAR(100) DEFAULT 'ðŸ§ ',
    color_start VARCHAR(7) DEFAULT '#FF7101',
    color_end VARCHAR(7) DEFAULT '#e55a00',
    
    -- Scheduling
    date DATE NOT NULL,
    start_time TIME NOT NULL,
    duration_minutes INTEGER NOT NULL,
    
    -- Linking
    linked_item_type VARCHAR(10),  -- 'goal', 'task', 'habit'
    linked_item_id INTEGER,
    
    -- Reminders
    reminder_minutes INTEGER,
    reminder_sent BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    
    -- Status
    status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'scheduled',  -- scheduled, in_progress, completed, cancelled
    completion_notes TEXT,
    
    -- Metadata
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    
    FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    
    INDEX idx_time_blocks_user_date (user_id, date),
    INDEX idx_time_blocks_datetime (date, start_time),
    INDEX idx_time_blocks_linked (linked_item_type, linked_item_id),
    INDEX idx_time_blocks_reminder (reminder_minutes, reminder_sent)
);
constraints: CHECK (linked_item_type IN ('goal', 'task', 'habit') OR linked_item_type IS NULL)
CHECK (reminder_minutes IN (15, 30, 45, 60) OR reminder_minutes IS NULL)

create_time_block.description: Creates a new time block with validation
create_time_block.implementation:
def create_time_block(user_id, block_data):
    # Validate input data
    errors = validate_time_block_data(block_data)
    if errors:
        raise ValidationError(errors)
    
    # Check for time conflicts
    conflicts = check_time_conflicts(user_id, block_data)
    if conflicts:
        raise ConflictError('Time slot already occupied')
    
    # Create time block
    time_block = TimeBlock(
        user_id=user_id,
        uuid=generate_uuid(),
        **block_data
    )
    
    db.session.add(time_block)
    db.session.commit()
    
    # Schedule reminder if requested
    if block_data.get('reminder_minutes'):
        schedule_reminder(time_block)
    
    return time_block

check_time_conflicts.implementation:
def check_time_conflicts(user_id, date, start_time, duration_minutes):
    start_datetime = datetime.combine(date, start_time)
    end_datetime = start_datetime + timedelta(minutes=duration_minutes)
    
    conflicts = TimeBlock.query.filter(
        TimeBlock.user_id == user_id,
        TimeBlock.date == date,
        TimeBlock.status != 'cancelled',
        # Check for overlap
        or_(
            and_(
                TimeBlock.start_time <= start_time,
                TimeBlock.start_time + TimeBlock.duration_minutes > start_time
            ),
            and_(
                TimeBlock.start_time < end_datetime.time(),
                TimeBlock.start_time >= start_time
            )
        )
    ).all()
    
    return conflicts
